isis.stitle: EC-17 ANTILOCK TRACTION CONTROLLER - ANTILOCK AND TRACTION SYSTEM OPERATION DURING COMPONENT FAILURE - SINGLE FAILURE

svcprocinfo.para: The following list describes how the antilock and traction systems respond to a specific component failure. (Note: right and left, front, mid and rear are determined from the driver's seat. Left front is therefore the corner closest to the driver.)

For example, if the right mid sensor fails, front and rear antilock will still be operative. Traction will be disabled. On those axles where antilock is disabled, the system reverts to standard air braking.

svcsubproc.title: Front Modulator
svcsubproc.para: If a front modulator fails, antilock on that wheel is disabled. Antilock and traction on all other wheels remain active.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Modulator
svcsubproc.para: A rear modulator failure disables the traction system. Antilock on that wheel will also be disabled, but antilock on all other wheels remains active.

svcsubproc.title: Front Sensor
svcsubproc.para: The wheel is still modulated using input from the opposite sensor on the front axle. The traction system is disabled.

svcsubproc.title: Mid or Rear Sensor
svcsubproc.para: In a four sensor system, antilock on that wheel(s) is disabled, but antilock on all other wheels remains active. In a six sensor system, antilock remains active using input from the remaining functional sensor. In both the four and six sensor system, traction control is disabled.

svcsubproc.title: Traction Solenoid
svcsubproc.para: Traction control is disabled. Antilock remains active.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Control Module
svcsubproc.para: If the engine control module (ECM) or the wiring from the EC-17 to the ECM fails, traction control is disabled. Antilock remains active.

svcsubproc.title: Voltage
svcsubproc.para: If system voltage is out of range, antilock and traction are disabled. The system reverts to standard air braking.
